page.title: 02Ide Hill
page.content: A renowned beauty spot on the highest point of the West Kent sandstone ridge about four miles S.W. of Sevenoaks and in the 'commuter belt'about 20 miles radius from central London. From the car park down the hill from the village green and behind the village hall there is the most superb view south across the Weald to the South Downs.Two or three miles south the landscape is dominated by the sheet of water that is Bough Beech reservoir. The immediate terrain of Ide Hill is farmland and woodland so that the traditional sources of employment are agriculture and forestry. Like many other Kentish villages this distance from London it has attracted many commuters and retired business people.
